intro: Tetrastigma glycosmoides, commonly known as the Indian grapevine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by clusters of round, black berries. It is often found in forested areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological studies.
